original: gang gi nub mo phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa dang /

translated: The Thus-Gone One is free from error, free from babbling, free from forgetfulness, free from different kinds of perceptions, free from unfocused minds, and free from indifference that is not thoroughly investigated.

original: 'dun pa nyams pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang; ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa dang /

analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang 'dris par byed pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / khyim la ser sna byed pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / 'du 'dzi'i gnas yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / gnod sems yongs su spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: One should abandon socializing with monks and nuns. One should abandon stinginess with regard to one’s home. One should abandon dwelling in crowds. One should abandon malice.

original: bdag la bstod pa yongs su spang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa yongs su spang bar bya zhing /
translated: One should abandon praising oneself.

original: gzhan la smod pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / khengs pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / @256b phyin ci log yongs su spang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan la smod pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / khengs pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / @256b phyin ci log yongs su spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: One should abandon disparaging others. One should abandon the ten unwholesome courses of action. One should abandon excessive pride and arrogance. One should abandon error.

original: the tshom yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi bag chags yongs su spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: the tshom yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi bag chags yongs su spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: They are: to completely abandon the five heinous actions, to completely abandon the ten unwholesome courses of action, to completely abandon the three lower realms, to completely abandon the three poisons, to completely abandon the four inversions, and to completely abandon doubt, the habitual tendencies of attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas chos bcu po de dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas chos bcu po de dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these are the ten dharmas that the bodhisattva mahāsattva abiding on the fifth ground should completely abandon.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva abiding on the sixth ground

original: chos drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: chos drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: should complete six dharmas.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: to complete the six perfections.

original: gzhan yang chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, he should completely abandon six dharmas.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: nyan thos kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su yi chad pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / slong ba mthong na sems zhum par mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su yi chad pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / slong ba mthong na sems zhum par mi bya ba dang /
translated: They are: to completely abandon the attitude of the śrāvakas, to completely abandon the attitude of the pratyekabuddhas, to completely abandon the attitude of discouragement, and not to be disheartened when they see a beggar.

original: dngos po thams cad yongs su btang nas yid mi bde bar mi bya ba dang / slong ba bskrad par mi bya ba ste /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yongs su btang nas yid mi bde bar mi bya ba dang / slong ba bskrad par mi bya ba ste / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas /
translated: They are: to give away all things and not to be unhappy about it, and not to turn away a beggar.

original: chos drug po 'di dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos drug po 'di dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the sixth level should completely abandon these six things.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu mi bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the seventh level should not do twenty things.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya ba dang / sems can du 'dzin pa dang / srog tu 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa dang / rtag par @257a *//
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya ba dang / sems can du 'dzin pa dang / srog tu 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa dang / rtag par @257a *//
translated: not grasping at self, not grasping at sentient beings, not grasping at life, not grasping at a person, not grasping at annihilation, not grasping at permanence,

original: 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / rgyur lta ba dang / ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa dang / phung po la mngon par zhen pa dang / khams la mngon par zhen pa dang / skye mched la mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / rgyur lta ba dang / ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa dang / phung po la mngon par zhen pa dang / khams la mngon par zhen pa dang / skye mched la mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: not having the perception of marks, not having the view of a cause, not clinging to name and form, not clinging to the aggregates, not clinging to the elements, not clinging to the sense sources,

original: khams gsum la mngon par zhen pa dang / khams gsum la lhag par zhen pa dang / khams gsum la chags pa dang / sangs rgyas su lta ba la rten cing mngon par zhen pa dang / chos su lta ba la rten cing mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: khams gsum la mngon par zhen pa dang / khams gsum la lhag par zhen pa dang / khams gsum la chags pa dang / sangs rgyas su lta ba la rten cing mngon par zhen pa dang / chos su lta ba la rten cing mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: not clinging to the three realms, not being attached to the three realms, not being desirous of the three realms, not relying on or clinging to the view of the Buddha, not relying on or clinging to the view of the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun du lta ba la rten cing mngon par zhen pa dang / tshul khrims su lta ba la rten cing mngon par zhen pa dang / chos rnams stong ngo zhes bya bas sgyid lug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun du lta ba la rten cing mngon par zhen pa dang / tshul khrims su lta ba la rten cing mngon par zhen pa dang / chos rnams stong ngo zhes bya bas sgyid lug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: They are: to rely on and cling to the view of a self, to rely on and cling to the view of a being, to rely on and cling to the view of a soul, to rely on and cling to the view of a person, to rely on and cling to the view of aggregates, to rely on and cling to the view of elements, to rely on and cling to the view of sense-spheres, to rely on and cling to the view of the perfection of giving, to rely on and cling to the view of the perfection of morality, to rely on and cling to the view of the Saṅgha, to rely on and cling to the view of morality, to be discouraged by the emptiness of phenomena, and to contradict emptiness.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu po de dag mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu po de dag mi bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the seventh level should not do these twenty dharmas.

original: sa bdun pa la gnas pa des chos nyi shu yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la gnas pa des chos nyi shu yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: “They should complete twenty dharmas.🔽What are the twenty?

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: stong pa nyid rtogs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / smon pa med pa shes pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad la snying brtse zhing snying rje ba dang / sems can de dag la brnyas par mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rtogs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / smon pa med pa shes pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad la snying brtse zhing snying rje ba dang / sems can de dag la brnyas par mi bya ba dang /
translated: to realize emptiness, to actualize the absence of attributes, to know the absence of expectation, to purify the three spheres, to have compassion and pity for all sentient beings, not to despise those sentient beings,

original: chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du lta zhing de la'ang mngon par zhen par mi bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i tshul rtogs shing /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du lta zhing de la'ang mngon par zhen par mi bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i tshul rtogs shing /
translated: to view all phenomena as equal and not to cling to that view; to realize the correct way

original: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya ba dang / mi @257b skye bar bzod pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / tshul gcig tu bstan pa dang / chos thams cad la rtog pa yang dag par gzhom pa dang / lta ba bzlog pa dang /
analyzed: des rlom sems su'ang mi bya ba dang / mi @257b skye bar bzod pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / tshul gcig tu bstan pa dang / chos thams cad la rtog pa yang dag par gzhom pa dang / lta ba bzlog pa dang /
translated: and not to be conceited about it; to accept non-arising; to know non-arising; to teach a single principle; to conquer all conceptual thoughts about phenomena; to turn away from views;

original: nyon mongs pa bzlog pa dang / zhi gnas nges par sems pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa'i sa dang / sems dul ba dang / sems zhi ba dang / shes pa thogs pa med pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i sa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzlog pa dang / zhi gnas nges par sems pa dang / lhag mthong la mkhas pa'i sa dang / sems dul ba dang / sems zhi ba dang / shes pa thogs pa med pa dang / rjes su chags pa'i sa ma yin pa dang /
translated: to turn away from afflictions; to be certain about śamatha; to be skilled in vipaśyanā; to have a disciplined mind; to have a peaceful mind; to have unobstructed knowledge; to not be on the level of attachment;

original: zhing gang du 'dod par 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: zhing gang du 'dod par 'gro ba ste /
translated: and to go wherever one wishes in the buddhafields.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu po de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas chos nyi shu po de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings who are established on the seventh level should perfect these twenty qualities.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas /
translated: Furthermore, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who stands on the eighth stage,🔽

original: chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the eighth level should complete four dharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:🔽entering the minds of all sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems la 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing la lta zhing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems la 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing la lta zhing /
translated: playing with the superknowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mthong ba de dag kyang yongs su bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bya zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mthong ba de dag kyang yongs su bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bya zhing /
translated: seeing the buddhafields and also accomplishing those buddhafields as they have been seen,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtag pa ste /
translated: and attending on the buddhas and also examining the body of the Buddha just as it is.

original: rab 'byor / chos bzhi po de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos bzhi po de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, they should complete those four dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the eighth level should complete four dharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing @258a *//🔽yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la rgyun mi chad par snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ji lta ji lta bur sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba de lta de lta bu'i lus yongs su sgrub cing /
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing @258a *// yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la rgyun mi chad par snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ji lta ji lta bur sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba de lta de lta bu'i lus yongs su sgrub cing /
translated: the knowledge of the higher and lower faculties of other beings,🔽the purification of a buddhafield,

original: bsam bzhin du srid pa nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: bsam bzhin du srid pa nye bar len pa ste /
translated: the uninterrupted meditative absorption in the illusion-like meditative stabilization, and the manifestation of a body in whatever way is necessary to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi po de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi po de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the eighth level should complete those four dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas chos bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas chos bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the ninth level should complete twelve dharmas.

original: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: smon lam mtha' yas pa yongs su bzung ba ste /
analyzed: smon lam mtha' yas pa yongs su bzung ba ste /
translated: the taking up of infinite prayers,

original: de smon lam ji lta ji lta bu 'debs pa de lta de lta bur 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
analyzed: de smon lam ji lta ji lta bu 'debs pa de lta de lta bur 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
translated: Whatever aspirations they make will be fulfilled.🔽They will understand the languages of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

original: lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes pa khong du chud pa dang / spobs pa'i klung khong du chud pa dang / mngal du 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / rus phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes pa khong du chud pa dang / spobs pa'i klung khong du chud pa dang / mngal du 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / rus phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: They will have the confidence of eloquence. They will have perfect entry into the womb, perfect family, perfect caste, perfect clan,

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / skye ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi shing gi bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan thams cad yongs @258b su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / skye ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi shing gi bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan thams cad yongs @258b su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: perfect retinue, perfect birth, perfect renunciation, perfect array of a tree of awakening, and perfect completion of all good qualities.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas chos bcu gnyis po de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas chos bcu gnyis po de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing on the ninth level should complete those twelve dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu pa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu pa la gnas pa ni /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing on the tenth level

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya'o //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya'o // de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: are called ‘thus-gone ones.’

original: bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: The Lord having said that,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang bar bgyi ba gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang bar bgyi ba gang lags /
translated: what is the superior intention of bodhisattva great beings standing on the first level that they have to purify?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa gang yin pa ste; rab 'byor /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa gang yin pa ste; rab 'byor /
translated: “It is the accomplishment of all wholesome roots with attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of higher intention.

original: de la sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the purification of the attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dag gis tshad med pa bzhi po byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mngon par bsgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dag gis tshad med pa bzhi po byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mngon par bsgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the accomplishment of the four immeasurables—love, compassion, joy, and equanimity—with attention directed toward the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa yongs su sbyang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa yongs su sbyang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the purification of the attitude of sameness toward all sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of giving?

original: sems @259a *// can thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med par sbyin pa sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: sems @259a *// can thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med par sbyin pa sbyin pa ste /
translated: It is giving gifts to all sentient beings without conceptualization.

original: de ni gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the purification of giving.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of attending on spiritual friends?

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag ni gang dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang dag par 'dzud cing 'jog la /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag ni gang dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang dag par 'dzud cing 'jog la /
translated: The spiritual friends of bodhisattva great beings are those spiritual friends who cause them to enter into and establish them in the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rab tu 'god par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la bsten pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / sri zhu byed pa ste; de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu 'god par byed pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la bsten pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / sri zhu byed pa ste; de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: and those bodhisattva great beings attend on, serve, and venerate them—this is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of attending on spiritual friends.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos tshol ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos tshol ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of seeking the Dharma?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis chos tshol bar byed la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi lhung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis chos tshol bar byed la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar yang mi lhung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the seeking of the Dharma with a mind endowed with omniscience, without falling into the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos tshol ba yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos tshol ba yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of seeking the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyun mi chad par mngon par 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyun mi chad par mngon par 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of uninterrupted renunciation?

original: tshe rabs thams cad du 'dre ba med par mngon par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: tshe rabs thams cad du 'dre ba med par mngon par 'byung zhing /
translated: It is renouncing in all lifetimes without mixing it with worldly dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la'ang rab tu 'byung la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la'ang rab tu 'byung la /
translated: It is going forth in the teachings of the Tathāgata.

original: su'ang @259b de'i bar chad byed par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: su'ang @259b de'i bar chad byed par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is not being obstructed by anyone.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyun mi chad par mngon par 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyun mi chad par mngon par 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of uninterrupted renunciation.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dod pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dod pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the desire for the body of a buddha?

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku mthong na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku mthong na /
translated: When they see the body of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob kyi bar du nam yang sangs rgyas yid la byed pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob kyi bar du nam yang sangs rgyas yid la byed pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: until they attain the knowledge of all aspects, they are never separated from keeping the Buddha in mind.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dod pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dod pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: Su­bhūti, this is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the desire for the body of a buddha.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par 'grel pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par 'grel pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the elucidation of the Dharma?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs kyang rung /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs kyang rung /
translated: Whether the tathāgatas are present or have passed into nirvāṇa,

original: mya ngan las 'das kyang rung sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das kyang rung sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: the bodhisattva-mahāsattva teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: tshangs par spyod pa thog mar dge ba /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa thog mar dge ba /
translated: It is the pure life, which is virtuous in the beginning,

original: bar du dge ba /
analyzed: bar du dge ba /
translated: virtuous in the middle,🔽and virtuous in the end.

original: tha mar dge ba /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba /
translated: It is virtuous in the end.

original: don bzang po /
analyzed: don bzang po /
translated: It has a good meaning.

original: tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po /
translated: It has good words.

original: ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa /
translated: It is unadulterated.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: It is complete.🔽It is pure.

original: yongs su byang ba /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba /
translated: It is purified.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang /
translated: the class of discourses, the class of songs, the class of declarations, the class of aphorisms, the class of specific narratives, the class of biographies, the class of parables,

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung pa'i chos kyi sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde @260a *//🔽dang; gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung pa'i chos kyi sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde @260a *// dang; gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde yang dag par ston pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: the class of former events, the class of extensive teachings, the class of the Buddha’s own words, and the class of establishing instructions.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par 'grel pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par 'grel pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of teaching the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal gyi khengs pa nges par gzhom pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal gyi khengs pa nges par gzhom pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ and great spiritual heroes’ thorough training of the destruction of the arrogance of pride consist in?

original: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa gzhom pa gang gis /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis khengs pa gzhom pa gang gis /
translated: It is the destruction of the arrogance of pride.

original: nam yang rigs dma' ba rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nam yang rigs dma' ba rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Through it, one will never be born into a low caste.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal gyis khengs pa nges par gzhom pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal gyis khengs pa nges par gzhom pa yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ and great spiritual heroes’ thorough training of the destruction of the arrogance of pride.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ and great spiritual heroes’ thorough training of truthful speech consist in?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa ste /
translated: to act in accordance with one’s words.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ and great spiritual heroes’ thorough training of truthful speech.

original: rab 'byor / bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas yongs su sbyang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / bcu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas yongs su sbyang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Subhuti, these are the ten things which the Bodhisattva, the great being, who stands on the first stage, should purify.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is the Bodhisattva, the great being's pure morality?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang / gzhan yang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims su byed pa /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dang / gzhan yang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims su byed pa /
translated: It is the non-performance of the thought of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, and also of other things which are a hindrance to morality,

original: byang chub la bar chad byed pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag yid la mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub la bar chad byed pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag yid la mi byed pa ste /
translated: and the non-performance of any dharmas which are an obstacle to enlightenment.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims @260b yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims @260b yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: This is the Bodhisattva, the great being's pure morality.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Bodhisattva, the great being's gratitude and thankfulness?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
translated: When the Bodhisattva, the great being, courses in the perfection of giving,

original: chung ngu zhig byas na'ang 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du chud mi gzon na /
analyzed: chung ngu zhig byas na'ang 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du chud mi gzon na /
translated: If even a small favor is not forgotten until the end of saṃsāra,

original: chen po lta ci smos te /
analyzed: chen po lta ci smos te /
translated: what need is there to speak of a great favor?

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa gzo zhing byas pa tshor ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s gratitude and appreciation.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s patience and strength?

original: gang sems can thams cad la gnod sems med cing rnam par 'tshe ba'i sems med pa ste /
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad la gnod sems med cing rnam par 'tshe ba'i sems med pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of malice and the absence of a harmful mind toward all sentient beings.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i stobs la gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s patience and strength.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mchog tu dga' zhing dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mchog tu dga' zhing dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s experience of supreme joy and delight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: theg pa gsum po dag la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po dag la sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
translated: It is bringing sentient beings to maturity in the three vehicles.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mchog tu dga' zhing dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mchog tu dga' zhing dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s experience of supreme joy and delight.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi btang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi btang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s not abandoning all sentient beings?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa ste /
translated: it is the protection of all sentient beings.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi btang ba yin no //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @261a *//
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi btang ba yin no // de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @261a *//
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s not abandoning all sentient beings.

original: chen po'i snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: chen po'i snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s actualization of great compassion?

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na /
translated: When the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices bodhisattva conduct,

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: he thinks like this:

original: sems can re re'i don gyi phyir yang bdag bskal pa chen po gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnyed du sems can dmyal ba dag tu 'dug la /
analyzed: sems can re re'i don gyi phyir yang bdag bskal pa chen po gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma rnyed du sems can dmyal ba dag tu 'dug la /
translated: For the sake of each and every being, I will remain in the hells for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: sems can de sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la ma bzhag gi bar du der bcad pa dang / gshag pa dang / brdung ba dang / btso ba dang / bsreg pa dag kyang nyams su myong bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can de sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la ma bzhag gi bar du der bcad pa dang / gshag pa dang / brdung ba dang / btso ba dang / bsreg pa dag kyang nyams su myong bar bya'o //
translated: Until that being is established in the wisdom of the Buddha, I will experience the pain of being cut, gashed, beaten, boiled, and burned there.

original: snyam ste / de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi phyir mngon par spro zhing yongs su mi skyo ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: snyam ste / de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi phyir mngon par spro zhing yongs su mi skyo ba'i bar du ste /
translated: In the same way, I will be enthusiastic for the sake of all beings, without ever becoming weary.’

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ great compassion.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla ma rnams la dad pas gus shing sri zhu che ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla ma rnams la dad pas gus shing sri zhu che ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ respect and reverence for gurus with faith?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: bla ma rnams la ston pa'i 'du shes 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: bla ma rnams la ston pa'i 'du shes 'jog pa ste /
translated: the perception of gurus as teachers.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla ma la dad pas gus shing sri zhu che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla ma la dad pas gus shing sri zhu che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s revering and serving the guru with faith and respect.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams brtson pas tshol pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams brtson pas tshol pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s seeking the perfections with diligence?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir las gzhan mi byed par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su tshol ba ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir las gzhan mi byed par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su tshol ba ste /
translated: not doing anything else but seeking the perfections in order to ripen all beings.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' @261b sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams brtson pas tshol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' @261b sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams brtson pas tshol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s seeking the perfections with diligence.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas chog mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas chog mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s not being satisfied with much learning?

original: 'di lta ste; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
translated: It is this: the bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not think, ‘I have learned this much, I have learned this far, I have learned this much now,’ and so on up to:

original: phyogs bcu khor yug gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar dag tu gang ci gsungs pa de thams cad gzung bar bya'o //🔽snyam du chog mi shes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu khor yug gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bar dag tu gang ci gsungs pa de thams cad gzung bar bya'o // snyam du chog mi shes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Whatever is taught in the world systems in the ten directions, up to the reaches of space, all that should be learned.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas chog mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas chog mi shes pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ insatiable attitude with regard to learning.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'grel bar byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'grel bar byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ insatiable attitude with regard to the gift of the Dharma?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos ston kyang chos kyi sbyin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des tha na byang chub la'ang re ba med pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos ston kyang chos kyi sbyin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des tha na byang chub la'ang re ba med pa ste /
translated: Even when bodhisattva great beings teach the Dharma, they do not even hope for awakening on account of the wholesome roots of the gift of the Dharma.

translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s production of roots of merit and dedication for the purification of the buddhafield?

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dang gang dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa bdag dang gzhan gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su sgrub pa ste /
translated: It is the production of roots of merit by which the buddhafield is purified, the roots of merit that purify one’s own buddhafield.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i @262a *//
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i @262a *//
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba yin no //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor ba dpag tu med pas yongs su mi skyo ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s not being discouraged by immeasurable saṃsāra?

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor ba dpag tu med pas yongs su mi skyo ba yin no //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa la gnas pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems la smod pa ste /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa la gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dgon pa la gnas pa yongs su mi btang ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dgon pa la gnas pa yongs su mi btang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dgon pa la gnas pa yongs su mi btang ba yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s not abandoning living in the wilderness.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems @262b dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dod pa chung ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub kyang mi 'dod pa gang yin pa ste /

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dod pa chung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dod pa chung ba yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s having few desires.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chog shes pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa mi btang ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: chos zab mo dag la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa mi btang ba yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas’ not giving up the ascetic practices and the good conduct.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bslab pa yongs su mi btang ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: gang la bslab pa thams cad rgyu ba med pa ste /
translated: It is where all training does not move.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bslab pa yongs su mi btang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bslab pa yongs su mi btang ba yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas’ not giving up training.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dod pa'i yon tan la smad pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'dod pa la sems mi bskyed pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: dpa' chen po'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: gang chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa ste /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ and great spiritual heroes’ giving rise to thoughts of the transcendence of suffering.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi chos rnams 'dzin par mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang ba yin no //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'dre ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: gang rnam par shes pa gnas pa rnams la de'i sems mi sbyor ba ste /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'dre ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s unadulterated mind.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dngos po thams cad la mi lta ba gang zhe na /

original: dngos po thams cad yid la mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yid la mi byed pa gang yin pa ste /

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dngos po thams cad la mi lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dngos po thams cad la mi lta ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s lack of regard for all things.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i khyim pa dang 'dris par byed pa yongs su spang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s avoidance of familiarity with householders?

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: @263b de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i khyim pa dang 'dris par byed pa yongs su spang ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s avoidance of familiarity with householders.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang 'dris par byed pa yongs su spang ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma rnams dang se gol gtogs pa srid du'ang lhan cig mi gnas shing /

analyzed: de dag med na'ang yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang 'dris par byed pa yongs su spang ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s avoidance of familiarity with monks and nuns.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i khyim la ser sna byed pa yongs su spang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ giving up of stinginess about home?

analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /

analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad la bde ba'i yo byad sbyar bar bya na /

analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni rang gi bsod nams kyis bde bar gyur pa yin gyi / 'di la bdag gis ser sna'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o //

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khyim la ser sna byed pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'du 'dzi'i gnas yongs su spang bar bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'du 'dzi'i gnas gang du gnas na /

translated: or the śrāvakas,

analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa bskyed pa 'gyur ba der byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gnas par mi bya ba ste /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'du 'dzi'i gnas yongs su spang ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great being’s avoidance of dwelling in a place of crowds.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gnod sems yongs su spang par bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gnod sems yongs su spang par bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great being’s avoidance of malice?

translated: It is not giving an opportunity to a malicious or violent thought, and not giving an opportunity to a thought of quarreling or a thought of contention.

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gnod sems yongs su spang ba yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great being’s avoidance of malice.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bdag la bstod pa yongs su spang ba gang zhe na /

original: gang nang gi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang nang gi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: It is the non-perception of internal phenomena.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bdag la bstod pa yongs su spang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bdag la bstod pa yongs su spang ba yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s avoidance of praising oneself.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gzhan la smod pa yongs su spang ba gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gzhan la smod pa yongs su spang ba gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: phyi rol gyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /

analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gzhan la smod pa yongs su spang ba yin no //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi @264b lam rnams yongs su spang bar bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s avoidance of the ten unwholesome courses of action?

analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag ni bde 'gro la'ang bar du gcod par byed na /

original: byang chub la lta ci smos pa ste /

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i nga rgyal yongs su spang bar bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /

original: 'di ltar des chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /🔽gang gis lhag par rlom sems su byed pa'i lhag pa lta ga la yod ces de ltar lhag pa'i nga rgyal spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos ci'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na / gang gis lhag par rlom sems su byed pa'i lhag pa lta ga la yod ces de ltar lhag pa'i nga rgyal spang bar bya'o //
translated: Since he does not see any phenomena at all,🔽how could there be any excess by which he would have excessive pride? Thus, excessive pride should be abandoned.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar khengs pa yongs su spang bar bya zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar gang la de'i khengs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos khengs pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phyin ci log yongs su spang bar bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva mahāsattva abandon in terms of mistaken views?

original: dngos po rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the nonapprehension of things.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phyin ci log yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phyin ci log yongs su spang bar bya'o //

translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva mahāsattva abandon in terms of the habitual tendencies of desire, anger, and ignorance?

analyzed: dang; zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyi dngos po yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi bag chags yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, bodhisattva great beings should eliminate the habitual tendencies of desire, anger, and ignorance.

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa drug pa la chos drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba gang zhe na /

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang; bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //

original: phyin to / phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin to / phyin par 'gyur ro //

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug po rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar yang nyan thos kyi @265b sems yongs su spang bar bya ste /
